metadata.title: CVE-2021-47244 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:Fix out of bounds when parsing TCP options The TCP option parser in mptcp(mptcp_get_options) could read one byte out of bounds. When the length is1, the execution flow gets into the loop, reads one byte of the opcode, andif the opcode is neither TCPOPT_EOL nor TCPOPT_NOP, it reads one more byte,which exceeds the length of 1. This fix is inspired by commit 9609dad263f8("ipv4: tcp_input: fix stack out of bounds when parsing TCP options.").
